messages.title: A message for UKIP supporters in Wallasey and Moreton from Theresa May's Conservative Candidate
messages.content: Dear resident, if you are one of the 5,063 who voted UKIP here in Wallasey in 2015, then I'd like to say 'thank you'. You may think it's a bit odd for a candidate from another Party to thank you for voting. But, thank you for the work of UKIP in the past, our country was finally given a referendum.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Deliver a successful Brexit to ensure that Britain will, once again, have control over immigration.
Ensure free trade with European markets, limit damage to jobs post-Brexit.
Committed to improving the NHS, schools and public services; also includes generating the money needed to pay for this investment.
Reducing net migration into the UK to the tens of thousands.

mentions.tacticalSituation: UKIP supporters switching their vote can ensure the Conservatives take Wallasey; tactical voting in this constituency is highlighted as the Conservative candidate needs just 5% more to win.

issues.brexitEurope: Deliver a successful and workable Brexit.
issues.economy: Limit damage to jobs post-Brexit, ensure free trade with European markets.
issues.immigration: Reducing net migration into the UK to the tens of thousands.

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm not a career politician. I'm a dad of four who has lived in the real world, I work as a builder and I am a big believer that Parliament needs more people who live in the real world.

politicalExperience.achievements: Worked for the Vote Leave team.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet specifically targets UKIP voters, thanking them for their past votes and encouraging them to vote Conservative to ensure a successful Brexit and improvements to public services.
